hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a period of low volatility (BTC 20-day realized volatility < 30%) during a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band (2 std) on expanding volume (>20% above 20-day avg) signals a short-term momentum move in the direction of the breakout.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes with suppressed volatility often precede directional moves. A high-volume breakout from a compressed range suggests institutional or large trader participation, providing a higher-probability momentum signal before the broader market recognizes the regime shift.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day Realized Volatility < 30% for at least 5 consecutive days
BTC price closes > Upper 20-day Bollinger Band (2 std)
BTC daily volume > 20-day average volume by 20%

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces to touch the 20-day SMA
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes back inside the Bollinger Bands

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such breakouts fail to sustain momentum (close back inside bands within 3 days) or result in immediate mean reversion, invalidating the 'expansion follows compression' premise.
